caseTitle: Secretary Establishment, Govt. of Pakistan, Islamabad v. Aftab Ahmed Manika & others
tagline: The Constitutional Jurisdiction of the High Court is not ousted in matters pertaining to appointment of a civil servant to a particular post or to be promoted to a higher grade. The appointing Authority has to make promotions in basic pay scales 20 and 21 only upon the recommendations of the Central Selection Board. Yet the law does not provide that the recommendations of the Board are binding and consequently be returned by the appointing Authority only when the procedure followed by the Board suffers from any factual or legal flaw.
